DOC.brief_summary: The objective study prospectively evaluate effect early versus delay removal transuretheral catheter follow sacrocolpopexy . The investigator specific aim determine optimal time removal indwell transurethral catheter postoperatively effort reduce risk postoperative urinary retention urinary tract infection associate catheter use . The investigator hypotheses follow : Hypothesis 1 : Longer duration postoperative catheter use result decrease postoperative urinary retention . Hypothesis 2 : Shorter duration postoperative catheter use result lower incidence urinary tract infection .
DOC.detailed_description: Patients schedule undergo sacrocolpopexy pelvic organ prolapse University Oklahoma Health Sciences Center recruit study . Written inform consent obtain participant prior schedule surgery randomization process . This study contain two arm , two group . The first arm participant receive sacrocolpopexy pelvic organ prolapse ; second arm consist participant receive sacrocolpopexy plus concomitant procedure stress urinary incontinence . Each participant assign arm match schedule procedure ; randomize one two study group within arm . Randomization perform placing note card seal envelope `` Group A '' `` Group B '' list card . One envelope place participant 's preoperative packet open day surgery operation complete.On date procedure , urinalysis perform prior routine administration prophylactic antibiotic . At begin procedure , transurethral catheter place routine procedure . At conclusion procedure , seal envelope contain participant 's group designation open assigned one two group . Group A participant catheter remove postoperative day 1 Group B catheter remove postoperative day 2 .
DOC.criteria: Age least 21 Scheduled undergo sacrocolpopexy University Oklahoma Health Sciences Center Age < 21 Elevated postvoid residual measurement preoperative exam History urinary retention Medical surgical indication prolong catheterization History neurologic problem
